column1: starts with a bit of a drifter down leg, Kayes has no hope of connecting with it.
back of a length, pushing it across the left-hander. Kayes ignores it
ripper! Rabada hits the deck and makes the ball seam past the outside edge. Pitches on leg stump, so Kayes has to play and is lucky not to nick off
tucks him up with a shortish delivery on middle and leg. Kayes tries to flick it away, but can't pull it off
defends a back of a length delivery on off stump. Rabada's getting just enough inward movement off the pitch to the left-hander
134kph, gets back in line with a shortish delivery on off stump

shifts across in his crease and the 140 kph delivery strikes him on the thigh with the outside half of leg stump behind it. Half an appeal from Rabada, but that might not have hit the stumps. Height and line, the issues
some curl through the air, but that only takes the full delivery onto the right-hander's pads. Das clips it neatly to long leg
blocks a shortish delivery on off stump. Kayes thinks about a single, but Miller, that 100 ODI veteran (feels weird to say that), is wise to those drop-and-run tactics.

outside edge flies away to the third man boundary and the crowd roars - a substantial portion of it is carrying Bangladesh flags. They might not have liked how the runs came about, with Kayes pushing at the ball, panicking upon seeing the full-length ball swinging away so late.
strikes on the thigh pad, which brings out an appeal from the debutant. But the ball must have pitched outside leg. Umpire Dar signals leg byes as the ball wanders out to deep third man
brings out a straight bat to handle an inswinger at 137 kph. Good shot, keeping the front leg from moving too far across.
blocks a good length ball, shaping in, against the angle moving off the pitch. Kayes defends with an inside edge
excellent leave as a 132 kph delivery hits the deck and darts past, just a sliver or two outside off stump
opens the face and guides a good length, 130kph ball behind point
whips a full delivery on leg stump to mid-on.

hostile! This is 130 kph, but it darts in off the pitch, off just a shortish length. So the batsman doesn't have too early a warning that he has to duck. Das sinks to his knees and sways his torso back to avoid damage
now the other one - angling in through the air and moving away off the pitch. This is class bowling. Beats the right-hander's tentative poke
not so much this time with the full ball at 140 kph straying down leg. Clips to long leg
good length ball at 139 kph, blocks it to cover
fine shot! That's a statement. A pull shot to tell the bowlers that they can't bully this team with bounce. Das picks the length early, and swats the ball well in front of square
pitches it further up and that makes the batsman be a little more circumspect. Straight bat block
moves back, and towards leg, to nudge the shortish ball meant to cramp him towards cover point
presses forward and crunches a full delivery at 138 kph to cover. He Das look good.
superb shot, just a gentle push down the ground, and it seemed set to go to the long-on boundary, until Imran Tahir throws himself to his left and keeps it to a single
138 kph, good length ball outside off, Das, without moving across to cover his stumps, leaves the ball. Brave. Especially with Rabada nipping the ball in off the deck
extra bounce as Das pushes forward to block and the ball thuds into the splice of the bat
141 kph, that's the ole teaser! Nearly a half-volley outside off, draws Das into the cover drive, with no feet. Then he outswing takes it past the outside edge
143kph, full on off stump, turns it to mid-on
a bouncer now, digs it in quite short, Das lets it go
another short ball, Das balls himself up under it
drills a full delivery at 137 kph to mid-on
full and outside off at 135 kph, Kayes drives superbly to cover
lets the short ball come to him and then deftly taps it through to deep third man. Super cricket.
smashes it through point. A little width outside off and Das places it to the right of the fielder and trusts his timing
back of a length on off stump, tucks it to midwicket
sensational drive down the ground! Moves forward serenely to meet the full length ball and taps it to the right of mid-off, concentrating on keeping his shape, and making sure the placement is right

hits the pad and goes to de Kock, who doesn't collect it cleanly - but wait, the umpire calls it a wide down leg. And Bongani Jele's right. It's the sound of the bat hitting his pads as it comes across the line
full on off stump, defends
goes short, but it wanders down leg again. Kayes lets it go and collects the extra
steers a full delivery outside off to point
clips a shortish delivery into the midwicket region. He is into the shot a touch too early and has to adjust his batswing
falls short of gully. Teasing the left-hander with wide stuff almost works. A touch more bounce than Kayes expects as he hangs out the fishing rod.
firm push to mid-off, pulling his front leg back to make sure he can bring the straight bat down on a ball curling into him from outside off

chaos! Having taken the effort to push the full length ball to the left of cover, but Paterson moves quickly to cut the angle and send in a sharp throw. Kayes is sent back just in time, and he puts in a desperate dive as well. No direct hit, and replays suggest it wouldn't have mattered either
checks his pull - because the ball seems to stop on him. But there is enough timing on it for the ball to dawdle away to the square leg boundary
good length ball on off stump, defends
nice shot, hanging back and beside the short ball to chop it on top of the bounce to deep third man
walks at the bowler and then hacks all across the line. For all that effort, he only gets a leading edge that soars away to the third man boundary. Terrible shot, but no arguing the outcome
bangs it in short, and in venting his frustration, he forgets to hold his line properly. Goes down leg and Kayes has an easy put away to long leg. All the pressure on him is being released
117kph, slower ball, down leg again, Kayes works it through square leg
steps forward neatly to a 145 kph full ball on off stump and gently pushes to mid-off. Not at all ruffled by high pace.
145 kph again, and Das is onto it again, driving sweetly down the ground. If not for a well-placed boot from Rabada, that would have been a boundary
pulls his bat inside the line of a back of a length delivery that seams away off the pitch at 137 kph
cuts back in off the seam at 141 kph and Das, with his habit of pushing the front leg across too early, gets closed off and is struck on the body
139 kph, short ball, angled into the right-hander. Das ducks and collects a wide. Pitched on off stump, and moved in off the seam

caught at second slip! But confirmation of that will have to come from the third umpire. And it looks like Das will have to go. Outstanding bowling from Rabada. Pitches on a good length. Makes it move away, against the angle and off the pitch. The batsman lunges forward to block with hard hands and looks back to watch Faf du Plessis snapping up a good low catch moving to his right
drills a full delivery at 140 kph to mid-off
quicker delivery on middle, clips to square leg
drifts down the pads as Kayes nudges it to short fine leg.
blocks another faster delivery on off stump. This at 91 kph

dropped, is it? Kayes goes for a reverse sweep and the ball lobs over the wicketkeeper - it's a googly, so he does try to hit with the turn. But ends up almost gloving it behind - the deflection is too much for de Kock
nudges a shortish delivery to deep square leg
steps out and works a full delivery to mid-on
blocks a full delivery on off stump at 139 kph
127kph goes for the cross-seam short ball, over off stump, Kayes reads it early and drops his wrists
another slower short ball, outside off, Rabada taps it behind square on the off side
too short, too wide, and Kayes wallops it to deep point. Fine shot. Takes advantage of a rare poor ball from Rabada
good length ball on off stump, defends
rides the bounce really well, and sends this 143 kph short delivery outside off to point
drives down the ground for a single
width and he lays into a square drive, but there is protection in the deep
nudges it off the pads to keep strike
short ball, drags it into the leg side
bangs it in, but the batsman spots it early and pulls it fiercely. Carries all the way.
back of a length and outside off, dabs it behind point for a single
guides it to third man
short ball, covers it well and keeps it down
turns it around to fine leg to keep strike
blocks a good length ball on the pads for a single through the vacant square leg region
defends a good length ball on off stump towards point
short ball is onto him a lot quicker than he is ready for. And the hook shot goes off the top edge, onto the helmet, and away to the fine leg fence. Sharp stuff from Pretorius
a little too tight on leg stump and Shakib works it to long leg
good length ball on middle, Kayes whips it to mid-on

strangled down leg. Such a poor way to go, even if he hasn't looked anywhere near his best. Short ball, ripe for a nudge to fine leg for a single. He does try just that, but ends up deflecting it straight into de Kock's gloves
a firm drive to mid-off. South Africa keeping their disciplines, with Phehlukwayo probing full and outside off
he is severely cramped by a back of a length delivery on middle and leg, but Shakib, with soft hands and an angled bat, still is able to dab it to deep third man

ripper! Hits the deck hard and gets the newish ball to dart away off the seam. Mushfiqur has to play, because the line is on off stump, and is comfortably beaten. 'Yes, boy. Yes boooy' come the encouraging shouts
shortish and outside off, punches to cover
gets in line with a shortish delivery on off stump
squares him up with a back of a length delivery nipping away off the pitch. The outside edge wanders to deep third man
full on off stump, pushes to mid-off. That looks like a knuckle ball from Pretorius
short and wide and Mushfiqur lashes it to the point boundary. Beautiful shot. Stands upright, ensures he places the ball to the left of the cover point fielder. Classy
a little too straight and Mushfiqur turns it around to long leg
shapes to push at the back of a length ball fairly hard, but then realises the perils of it and lets it come closer to thud into his open bat face
full on middle, Shakib works it to midwicket. There's a slight misfield, tempting the Bangladeshi batsmen to go for a single, but Amla recovers quickly enough
shortish on middle, tucks it to long leg
full on middle stump, punched to mid-on
back of a length on middle and off, defended into the covers
length ball on off stump, he's bowling a really good line this over, giving Shakib no room at all. Defended to short extra-cover
slower bouncer, called wide for height, belatedly, after Shakib ducks under it. Well over head height when it passed him
length ball outside off, opens his bat face and dabs to backward point
back of a length on off stump, pulled to deep square leg - I think he'd have ordinarily played that with a straight bat, in the V, but all those dots led him to try something different
full on the pads, clipped to long leg
full on off stump, and that's lovely, just shows the full face and punches through the line to send it racing away between the stumps and the non-striker
back of a length on middle stump, tucked to square leg
fullish on off stump, defended to mid-off
back of a length slower ball on off stump, defended towards mid-off
length ball on middle and off, whipped away to the left of long leg
back of a length slower ball on off stump, clipped away through square leg
fullish, slanting away from off stump, punched to sweeper cover
back of a length on off stump, punched to point
down the track, and that's nicely done. Saw him coming and banged it in short, angling into his body, but he still managed to flat-bat it down the ground, between the umpire and the non-striker
back of a length close to off stump, punched to deep point
short on leg stump, pulled to long leg
back of a length, angling into middle and leg, defended towards mid-on
back of a length close to off stump, opens his bat face to guide it down to third man
back of a length on off stump, opens his bat face to steer to the right of backward point
length ball on middle and off, defended back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, dabs to third man and becomes only the fifth player to score 5000 runs and take 200 wickets in ODIs, after Jayasuriya, Afridi, Kallis and Razzaq.
bouncer over off stump, focuses on keeping the ball down rather than hitting hard, so ends up playing a tennis-style smash to square leg
and again, bouncer over off stump, pulled to the left of long leg
shortish on off and middle, pulled to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, skips away to make room and chops it down to third man
length ball on middle stump, clipped to the left of midwicket
back of a length on middle and leg, clipped towards midwicket
back of a length on off stump, leans back and back-cuts to the left of the diving backward point fielder and the right of third man
bouncer over middle and leg, Shakib ducks and it's called wide again
back of a length on middle and off. Stays next to the line of the ball, but doesn't have enough room to dab this fine of short third man
tossed up slow and full on the pads, clipped through backward square leg
shortish, but not too much width, chopped to backward point
tossed up on off stump, driven to extra-cover
fullish on off and middle. Looks to drive towards long-on, gets a thickish inside edge that rolls through square leg
back of a length, googly, rips past the inside edge  of his attempted flick and hits high on the thigh
slider angling down leg, misses the flick. Half-appeal for caught behind. Not given, not called wide either. Maybe flicked his thigh pad too
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away to long leg
back of a length on middle stump. Looks for the single after flicking into the leg side but AB moves quickly to his right from midwicket and forces him to turn back
back of a length, angling down leg. Misses the flick and rolls into the square leg region off the pads
slower bouncer, gets up to chest height. Reads it well, opens up, and uses his bottom wrist well to shovel a pull to the vacant backward square leg boundary
back of a length, leg-sidish, tucked off the hip to long leg
back of a length angling down leg, doesn't really middle the pull and it rolls away into the backward square leg region with the keeper giving chase
fullish on off stump, eases a drive down to long-off

googly, lovely flight on that one. Angles it across the left-hander and achieves some dip. Reaches away from his body to drive, misses, and momentarily overbalances and lifts his back leg, but he grounds it before QdK can take the bails off
another googly, quicker and shorter, slides past the attempted dab to third man
shortish on middle and off, doesn't really bounce that high, drags a pull to midwicket off the inside half of the bat
flighted ball outside off, gets down low to sweep on the bounce to deep square leg
another googly, spins in from wide of off and Mushfiqur tucks it away through square leg
shortish outside off, chopped to backward point
shot. Shuffled across premeditatedly, and got down on one knee instantaneously when he spotted the off-stump line and the fullish length, and swept in the air, to the left of short fine leg
back of a length on off and middle, shuffles across to work it to deep square leg and bring up the 50 partnership
down the track and Duminy bowls it shorter and straighter to cramp him for room. Stabbed away into the cover point region
full on middle and off, a fumble from AB at midwicket, moving to his right, allows a single

makes plenty of room and gets a flighted ball on off stump. Hits a hard flat-bat drive to the left of cover point, and Rabada gets a hand to it with a dive and slows the ball down, preventing a possible boundary
quickish length ball on middle and leg, defended back to the bowler
tossed up on middle stump, steps forward to clip through square leg
tossed up close to off stump, defended into the cover point region
shapes to reverse-sweep and gets a gift from Tahir, a flighty full-toss that he slaps away between short third man and backward point
tossed up on leg stump, swept to long leg

got him! A slip in place and he dangles up a slow, loopy delivery wide of off. Reaches for the drive, doesn't get to the pitch, and it's the googly as well, and it catches the edge through to Amla at slip
starts the new spell with a jaffa. A legcutter in the corridor, just back of a length, and squares up Mushfiqur and beats his outside edge
back of a length on off stump, defended to midwicket
back of a length, close to off stump, opens his bat face and dabs to backward point
length ball on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
short and wide, has to jump up because it bounces quite high, but controls his uppercut nicely to put it away to the right of backward point
back of a length on middle stump, lets it come on and defends with soft hands, to the right of midwicket
short outside off, slapped hard and cover point moves quickly to his left to stop it
tossed up on leg stump, clipped to midwicket

shortish, pitches outside off and rips in sharply. Mushfiqur may have picked the googly, but maybe not the extent of turn. Wanted to run it down to third man, and the flap of his back pad got in the way of his bat. Hit the flap first, and only then the bat. Big appeal, not given, no review. Maybe struck him outside the line
tossed up outside off, lofted in the air, on the bounce, to the left of long-off
full on off stump, clipped to long-on
tossed up wide of off, reaches out to drive to extra-cover
shortish outside off, doesn't get his back leg across to cut, just throws his hands at it, and the ball beats his bat

down the track now, makes himself room, and gets a length ball just outside off. Frees his arms and flat-bats it over the covers and it carries all the way to bring up a superb half-century. He's looked in total control right from the time he walked in, and he's been so proactive
back of a length on off stump, defended to backward point
short on middle stump, swivels through a pull to place it to the right of deep square leg
back of a length outside off, opens his bat face to steer to third man
back of a length on middle and leg, tucked into the square leg region
back of a length on middle and leg, sticks in the pitch slightly. Shows the full face to pick up a single to long-on - it hung in the air for a brief while
quicker ball outside off, left alone. Shaped to cut, but realised that it wasn't short enough for it. Playing the trajectory rather than the length

tossed up outside off, misses the sweep and he's hit on the pad. Rolls away to the left of the keeper and they run a leg-bye. Struck him outside the line, I think, but they've still reviewed. It's the googly, so it's probably hitting the stumps, but he stretched a fair way forward and across and it's definitely hit him outside the line
quickish length ball on middle stump, clipped to long-on
quickish length ball close to off stump, defended into the covers. Played slightly away from his body, without really getting a stride in
shot. Tossed up fuller this time, and he gives Mahmudullah a bit of width. Drives it powerfully, again going at it with his hands, and it races away in a flash to the point boundary
shortish on off and middle, Mushfiqur plays a controlled pull out to deep square leg
length ball angling down leg. Doesn't connect with the flick, gets a little tickle of pad on it down to long leg
slower short ball on off stump, pulled to the left of deep square leg
slower length ball on the pads, clipped to the left of midwicket

slower bouncer outside off. Pulls to the right of midwicket and nearly sets off for a single, but turns back, and wisely so, because AB sprints across, dives, and flicks a direct hit at the striker's end
another slower bouncer outside off, plays a controlled overhead smash to deep square leg
sharply spinning googly, cramps Mushfiq after pitching just back of a length. Tucked to midwicket
skips out now and Tahir bowls it full at his legs. Clipped to midwicket

goes for the sweep, top-edges, and he's lucky that falls into a gap. Doesn't quite get his head over the ball, and the bounce causes him to send a top-edge looping high in the air, but it falls between deep midwicket and deep backward square leg
long-hop, a bit of width too, Mahmudullah goes on the back foot and punches it to the cover boundary
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off past the diving extra-cover fielder
tossed up on middle and leg, clipped to deep backward square leg
prepares the scoop over the wicketkeeper's head, but as well as he positioned himself - facing the bowler, feet apart, the bat becoming a shovel, going from down to up - he misses the line
back of a length on middle and leg, Mushfiqur clips it behind square leg
backs away - but by doing so far too soon, he allows the bowler to follow him with a shortish delivery. With no room on offer, he can only defend
shot-arm pull, and the ball scurries away to deep square leg
slower ball on off stump, defends

waits on the shortish delivery, dabs it to the right of the wicketkeeper, they think about the quick single, but de Kock dives to his right and prevents them from doing so. And we've got drinks on the field
pushes forward to a 137 kph good length ball outside off and blocks to point
that's a bouncer, at 134 kph, and Mushfiqur sways out of its way
width on offer and Mushfiqur flays it through to the sweeper cover. He's been so well balanced at the crease

that's a monster hit! The short ball comes in 140 kph, but it's gone off the bat way quicker. Phew. Mahmudullah runs down the track at South Africa's quickest bowler and then tonks him over deep midwicket. Flat, hard, six
the riposte is a bouncer, on middle and leg, Mahmudullah sways out of the way
blocks a good length ball at 140 kph to cover
reads the slower bouncer well and then pulls it out to deep square leg. Only 96 kph on that offcutter, pitching in Pretorius' own half of the pitch
fuller delivery outside off, Mahmudullah defends through the vacant cover region
nudges a shortish delivery off his hips, but square leg is on hand
a little bit of room outside off and Mushfiqur chops it away to deep third man

prepares to leave the short ball. Then he realises there is no pace on it and perhaps he could catch up with the ball and pull it away. But by that time the ball has passed over his shoulder to the wicketkeeper

shapes to steer the back of a length delivery to third man, but the deflection goes too fine and for half a second he fears he might be caught behind. But the ball falls short of de Kock diving to his right, and because of that he can't collect it cleanly
swivels on his back foot and pulls the slower short ball to deep square leg
gets up with the short ball on middle and clips it to midwicket. Amla ambles in, but over-runs the ball and almost gives up an extra run
angles into the right-hander and cramps him well enough that Mahmudullah gets an inside edge onto his thigh

legcutter, which takes the outside edge and scurries to the third man boundary. Change of pace bites into the pitch, moves off the straight and takes enough of Mahmudullah's bat to elude the diving de Kock
short of a length on off stump, defends
he's getting some nip into the right-hander, more so it's happening so very late off the pitch that Mahmudullah can't quite read it. Only just manages to save himself from trouble with an inside edge
wicket-to-wicket again and this time Mahmudullah is able to block it well
good length ball on middle and leg, turns it to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, defends
try, try and try again until you scoop a fast bowler to the fine leg boundary and laugh in his face. Sensational shot. Picks the perfect ball for it too. Full one, sliding down leg, easy pickings
so out comes the slower bouncer - seems to be his go-to - and the ball soars over the right-hander's head as he tries to pull.

picks the off-pace bouncer, waits on it, his body already in position for the pull shot and then whisks it over midwicket fielder. Super stuff. Not really easy to hit those balls well enough that they almost carry to the boundary
back of a length on off stump, pushes to midwicket
back of a length and outside off, hacks it away to midwicket
back of a length and outside off, goes too far outside off. Mahmudullah ignores it and collects a wide
legcutter, which is slapped behind point for a single
good length ball, shaping into the right-hander and again Mahmudullah is not properly in line. Defends pushing his hands on off stump only to get an inside edge
punches a shortish delivery through the covers
full on middle, Mushfiqur swings right across it and somehow sends the ball out to deep square leg. Could easily have been bowled there
hauls a good length ball on off stump out to deep square leg.

that's gone straight up.... and falls perfectly in Miller's hands. Fine catch, he has to keep his eyes on it against the sun - the shades help with that - has to run back a bit from cover and then take it reverse-cupped before falling over. Big wicket for South Africa, engineered by Pretorius' slower ball. That's all he's cared to bowl in this spell, banging it into the pitch and making batsmen forget about ever trying to hit straight. Mahmudullah tries to make his own pace by running down the track for a flay over cover. Doesn't succeed
nudges a shortish delivery out to midwicket
swivels on the back foot to pull the short ball from outside off to the backward square leg boundary. Lovely shot
on the pads, clips to backward square leg
defends a fuller delivery on off stump, no room on offer, not quite the length to get under and launch over the bowler's head either
back of a length on off stump, blocks it. Finishes his spell with figures of 2 for 48. That's top work for an allrounder
fuller delivery on off stump, pats it down to mid-off
smashes a short ball out to Rabada at sweeper cover
defends a fuller delivery on off stump. Paterson doing well to prevent giving any room
spears a drive out to deep point
clears the front leg and cuts a shortish delivery to point
looks for the yorker on middle, but it tails into leg and makes Mushfiqur work doubly hard to keep it out
pushes it through on off stump, Sabbir punches it to cover
he's unsure how the ball will turn, and this one, pitched further up adds to his anxiety. Eventually, he reads it as a legbreak off the pitch and even then only outside edges to point
fires it in on off stump, Sabbir defends
seems to be the googly, which is turned away behind square leg
sliding onto the pads, Mushfiqur attempts to dab it to fine leg. Doesn't make contact. Sabbir, though, is haring down for a single and has to be sent back
shortish and outside off, Mushfiqur pats it to extra cover
there's a noise as the ball passes the bat, and bounces over the stumps. Mushfiqur goes for the good old heave ho, across the line of a length ball, and has nothing to show for it
spots Mushfiqur's front leg being pushed away and so looks for the wide yorker. Perfect ball to unsettle a batsman premeditating

launches it over square leg! Amazing strike! And it's taken a little bit out of him, because he's stretching his legs, seemingly cramping up. Get some fluids in, man. You're in prime form. Keep going. Just like this - taking a ball that isn't all that short and clobbering it over the boundary
full toss, right over the wide line. Mushfiqur, after that attack of cramps, can't quite reach that far and is bewildered that that isn't penalised by the umpire
another yorker outside off, with Mushfiqur trying to keep leg side of the ball to slog. Splendid execution, by the debutant
three on the trot - another yorker, skirting the wide line and though Mushfiqur is prepared for it, he still can't get bat to ball. So five dot balls and a six, not a bad over at all.
gets down the track and drives with a straight bat to long-off
pushes the legbreak into leg stump, and Mushfiqur, despite making room, is still too cramped to free the arms. Has to settle for a single to cover
sweeps a full delivery from outside off to deep square leg

shapes for the reverse sweep - and that's a fine shot because third man is up and the line of this ball is well outside off. Lovely batting. Highest score by a Bangladeshi batsman against South Africa
defends a tossed up delivery on off stump. He's definitely having trouble moving around because of cramps

another reverse sweep! Mushfiqur has had a splendid day today, and it continues with him taking a good length ball on off stump - which otherwise would have been a single down the ground - becomes four past point's left
steps out and smears a length ball outside off to long-on
moves across outside off to be in position to reach the wide yorkers - and it works as Mushfiqur slices the ball to deep third man. The crowd's revving itself up. Brilliant atmosphere.

fine leg comes up, so Sabbir tries a scoop. Only problem, Paterson keeps executing the wide yorker with pin-point precision. Lands just inside the wide line and does not allow the batsman to access the leg side

superb hit! This is in the blockhole, outside off stump, but Sabbir is waiting for it. Opens the face to beat the man at point inside the circle and then the timing is good enough to beat the man in the deep too
launches a full toss over deep square leg! Outstanding hit, taking full toll of the bowler's length going wrong. Yorker sits up to be smashed
continues backing his strength and delivers a stinging, inswinging yorker to end the over with a dot ball
nudges a full delivery down to long-on. He's three shy of a well-deserved century
jumps back quickly enough to slice a shortish delivery off the stumps to point
comes down the track, but ends up yorking himself. Tahir does well diving to his left to stop the straight drive
turns a slower than usual ball on leg stump to long leg
picks the googly and nudges it away to deep square leg
tosses it up outside off, defends in front of point
too quick! And the short ball, climbing up to his right ear, cramping him for the hook shot to be of any effect
holes out to the sweeper cover! The ole one-two works out just fine as Rabada bowls it full and wide outside off. Sabbir slices it but doesn't quite put in the power he would like

becomes the first Bangladesh batsmen to hit a hundred against South Africa in ODIs. It happens with a little push past short cover's left, and some desperately quick running, on feet that were cramping not too long ago. Splendid innings, played the world No. 1 bowler Tahir expecially well.
shortish and outside off, taps it to deep third man
goes short and outside off, Sabbir ignores it and Rabada has probably gotten away with a wide not being called
back of a length and outside off, chops it to deep third man
offcutter, just short of a good length. Nasir drags it to long-on

takes ages to arrive, does the slower ball bouncer. So much that Mushfiqur is on his back foot, his backlift high and ready to pull and he waits a full second or two before finally swinging and sending the ball to deep square leg
nails the yorker, right on middle, this time and all Nasir can do is protect his stumps
a little bit of width and the slower short ball is crashed away through backward point
full delivery wanders down leg side.
off the back of the hand, and Nasir pastes it away to long-off.
steps out, but Phehlukwayo follows him with a good length ball, cramping him and securing his inside edge
hammers it through cover and brings up Bangladesh's highest score against South Africa in ODIs. Fiercely hit, coming down the track against the fastest bowler on show today
pulls it straight to midwicket. Short ball, angled into the right-hander, who duly sends the ball straight into the hands of Amla, the only player inside the circle on the leg side
back of a length and outside off stump, the left-hander pushes to point
races down the pitch to slog across the line of a 141 kph delivery. Gets a leading edge out to deep third man
back of a length, cramping him, cutting off his scoring areas on the off side, but Mushfiqur sways away from the line and lifts it to third man
full toss on leg stump, clips it to square leg, where Paterson misfields
lashes a slower ball out to the deep point fielder. Good fielding from Tahir to keep it to just a single
low full toss outside off, Saifuddin drills it to extra cover
pulls the slower bouncer out to deep square leg
plants a wide yorker just about perfectly - the batsman can't get under it, and he skirts on the right side of the guideline
toe-ends a slog to long-off
paddle-sweeps a full toss to the right of the short fine leg. Showcasing possibly the greatest aspect of his innings so far - his placement
the wide yorker goes awfully wrong for Rabada, and it catches in the breeze as well to wander way past the guideline
full toss, launched out to de Villiers at wide long-on, who for the second time on camera, keeps testing the movement on his right shoulder.
full on off stump, Mushfiqur clears his front leg but doesn't quite have the room for a big shot. Single to long-on
carves a half-volley through cover and mid-off. Briliant shot.

well done, de Kock, diving to his right to stop the ball racing away to the boundary. But as it happens, it is a dead ball, umpire Dar saying Saifuddin was purposefully getting his pad out of the way of the ball
what a shot! Sails over deep square leg! Fersome bouncer from Rabada, but the debutant stands his ground and pulls it away and its a mighty hit
another short ball, this one is top-edged to midwicket and Rabada wraps up with four wickets
lovely. De Kock begins with a boundary. A bit of swing in, but it's a touch overpitched, swinging into middle, and he leans into a clip between mid-on and midwicket
a touch shorter, swinging into middle stump again, clipped away to deep square leg
length ball angling into the pads, clipped gently into the midwicket region
back of a length on middle and off, goes back and across to work it through square leg
again too straight, angling into the pads and Amla flicks to deep square leg
back of a length, angling away from off stump. Opens his bat face to stab to backward point

back of a length outswinger, starts on a fifth-stump line and curves further away at a gentle pace. Doesn't come on for the back-foot slap, and he inside-edges it past his stumps, to the left of the keeper
length ball, fourth-stump line, presses forward and blocks into the cover-point region
length ball slanting away from off stump, left alone
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
length ball slanting across towards off stump, clipped to midwicket
fullish on middle and off, driven crisply to the left of mid-off, who's quite wide, and as a result it's the man at mid-on who gives chase
drifts onto the pads again, and Amla picks up another wristy single to deep square leg
back of a length, swinging towards QdK's pads, and he flicks to short fine leg
back of a length, fourth-stump line, jabbed to backward point
fullish outside off, driven to the right of mid-off, where Mashrafe makes a tumbling stop
back of a length, angling into off stump and cramping Amla for room. Defends with soft hands towards backward point
length ball on off stump, punched firmly and extra-cover dives left to stop it
wide length ball, gets a nice stride out for a flat-bat slap to deep point
length ball angling into middle stump, clipped to the right of deep square leg
length ball outside off, lets it come on and dabs it gently into the backward point region
length ball on middle and off, lets it come on and defends with soft hands into the point region
fullish, close to off stump, looks like the slower one. Defended back down the pitch
back of a length, a bit of inward nip towards off stump, punched to midwicket
length ball close to off stump, defended to extra-cover
length ball on middle stump, clipped to square leg

back of a length on leg stump, whipped to the right of short fine leg, Taskin, who sprints and dives and can't quite cut it off, and they pick up two by the time the man at deep square leg can run around to stop it
length ball close to off stump, a tiny bit of inward shape. Looks to stand still and punch through the covers, gets a thick inside edge into his back leg
fullish outside off, and de Kock leans forward, without taking too big a stride, and brings his bottom hand into play for a whippy drive down the ground, between the non-striker and mid-off
back of a length on leg stump, clipped to deep square leg
back of a length, slanting across towards off stump. Looks to clip into the leg side, closes his face too early, and the leading edge rolls softly into the point region
back of a length close to off stump, punched to the left of mid-off
back of a length, slanting across the left-hander, dabbed to backward point
fullish slower ball on middle stump, pushed gently towards mid-off. Mashrafe dives across but can't intercept
length ball, fourth-stump line, punched to mid-off
length ball, a little closer to off stump, shuffles across to work it through square leg
full, angling into off stump from wide of the crease, driven through point with an open face, past the left hand of the diving cover point fielder
length ball, slanting into a fourth-stump line. Too early into his attempted cover drive, too much bottom hand, gets an inside edge that rolls towards midwicket
a bit more width this time, stretches forward and opens his  bat face to steer it down to third man
ooh. Back of a length close to off stump. Looks to dab to third man and gets an inside-edge that doesn't miss off stump by much
full, very wide of off stump, leans forward, gets his head over the ball, and makes a sweet-sounding angled-bat contact with it to send it racing through the covers
fullish, angling into off stump, shows the full face to push to mid-off
back of a length on off stump. Opens his bat face to dab to backward point
back of a length close to off stump, opens his bat face and squeezes it into the gap to the right of backward point
slower length ball on middle and off. Thinks of flicking through midwicket initially, then adjusts and defends into the off side
back of a length on middle and leg, uses his wrists to play that to midwicket
length ball, fourth-stump line, steered to backward point
back of a length on off stump, defended to extra-cover
in the blockhole close to off stump, squeezed out to cover

short, angling down leg. Bad ball with fine leg in the circle, and Amla swivels to pull to the right of the fielder. He does well to dive and get his hand to hit, but the ball still manages to roll all the way to the boundary
back of a length, angling into middle stump, clipped to the right of midwicket
fullish on off stump, and that is gorgeous. Just shows it the full face and bisects extra-cover and mid-off. A lovely way to bring up South Africa's 50
full on middle stump, blocked to mid-on
that's superb placement. Full, a bit of width, and Amla opens his bat face through his drive and finds the boundary to the left of deep point
low full-toss on off stump, meets it with the full face and drives to the right of long-off. Taskin sprints and dives, gets a hand to it too, but can't prevent it from running away to the boundary
tossed up outside off, driven to cover
back of a length on off stump, goes back and across to whip through wide mid-on
full, angling into middle and off, clipped to deep midwicket
short outside off, slapped to point
length ball close to off stump, stays back to punch to extra-cover
back of a length on off stump, clipped through square leg
fullish, angling into off stump. Pushed gently towards mid-on and they chance a single. de Kock has to hurry to beat the throw home, but there's no direct hit anyway
slower bouncer outside off, Amla plays a controlled pull to deep square leg
back of a length outside off, punched past the man at extra-cover, who may have got a hand to it, and mid-off runs around to mop up
full on middle stump, clipped to the left of midwicket and they run a quick single
slower ball, fairly full on off stump, defended to extra-cover
full on middle stump, pushed down to long-on
back of a length on off stump. Looks to go back and punch into the covers, only manages an inside-edge that rolls towards midwicket
fuller now, driven down to long-on
full on the pads, clipped to deep square leg
down the track and Shakib bowls it flatter and quicker, angling into the batsman, who shows a full face to pick up a single to long-on

back of a length, angling into off stump. Lets it come on and dabs gently to the right of backward point. He sprints in, picks up, and throws to the bowler's end, but they complete the single easily, and there's no one backing up so they also pick up an overthrow
down the track and he gets a fullish ball on middle stump. Drives firmly but straight to mid-on
back of a length on off stump, punched back to the bowler
shortish on leg stump, and de Kock puts it away in some style, a whippy pull off his hip that rushes to the backward square leg boundary
back of a length, slower offcutter angling across towards off stump. Whipped to deep square leg
length ball angling into off stump, defended with an open face towards backward point
slower short ball  on off stump, shuffles across and helps it to long leg
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
flat, angling into the pads, clipped to deep square leg
back of a length close to off stump, looks to punch to long-off but Shakib moves left quickly to cut it off
flat, angling down leg, nice take from Liton moving left after Amla misses his flick
short, wide, Amla just throws his hands at it and slices it whippily to the third man boundary
back of a length close to off stump, punched to long-on
down the track and Shakib bowls it flat and full. Punched back towards the bowler
back of a length slower ball, fifth-stump line. Lets it come on and guides it down to third man
back of a length, angling away from off stump. Leans back and slashes with an angled bat, and misses
slower ball on leg stump, and he takes a huge step across and gets down low in a flash to sweep it in the air, over short fine le. What a shot
length ball close to off stump. Looks to drive through the covers, I think, but ends up playing a little early and dragging it down the ground to long-on, with a lot of bottom hand
back of a length close to off stump. Looks for the dab to third man but can't place it fine enough. Backward point moves quickly to his left to cut off the single
length ball angling into the pads, flicked to the left of deep square leg
tossed up full on leg stump, clipped to deep square leg
full, round-arm, angling into off stump, clipped to midwicket
fullish, angling into middle stump, driven to long-on
length ball on middle and leg, driven with a straight bat to midwicket
length ball on middle stump, whipped to midwicket
shortish on off stump, makes room and cuts to backward point
length ball on off stump. Looks to punch to long-on and Saifuddin tumbles to his left to intercept
down the track and he bowls a slower ball at his pads. Clipped to midwicket

length ball angling across to off stump, and de Kock brings up fifty with another lovely inventive shot. Steps across his stumps and flicks the ball over his shoulder. Fine leg is back, but he's a touch too square to be able to cut this off
back of a length outside off, chopped down to backward point
fullish on leg stump, and again he targets the fine-leg region. Goes down low for a lap-sweep, and manages to place it extremely fine
on the pads, clipped to deep square leg
carves a shortish delivery outside off to deep point
blocks a full delivery on off stump to short midwicket
nudges it through square leg for a single
drives to the right of point to keep the strike ticking over
gently taps a full delivery to long-on
defends the straighter one, going on with the arm, from around the wicket
full on off stump, pushes down the ground
fifty for the mighty Hash and it's achieved in typically understated style - with a push to long-off. He's only hit four fours in the innings, but is functioning at a strike-rate of 104. Classy.
tickles a full delivery around the corner for a single to square leg
turns a good length ball, with the spin, behind square leg
calmly taps a pitched-up delivery to long-on
clips it through midwicket and jogs through to the other end. He's sleepwalking this chase.
backs away and drills a flat delivery on off stump to long-off
pushes a good length ball to cover
finds the gap between points backward and cover. Excellent shot, made by the footwork as he jumps back so early to cut a ball that is pretty much on off stump
fuller delivery on off stump, blocks
drives it through cover
works a flatter delivery off his pads to deep square leg
drives serenely to long-off
cramps him with a quicker ball, going on with the arm from around the wicket. De Kock keeps it out
leans over the tossed up delivery and clips it to the left of long-on
pats a good length ball to long-off

there is a single there, but Amla is not ready for it. De Kock has done all the work he needs to, picking the gap to the right of short fine leg, playing the ball softly enough and is jogging through. But suddenly he looks up and sees his partner not even the slightest bit interested and has to rush back to his crease
kicks his front leg away and cuts the flat delivery off the stumps through cover point. Super shot
starts short and it's been pulled to deep square leg
works a shortish delivery off his pads to deep square leg
crunches a full delivery on off stump to cover
slaps a length ball to mid-off. Those were leaking singles when the spinners were bowling because the fielders were on the boundary. Something different from Bangladesh
pulls the short ball to deep square leg
full and just outside off, Amla blocks to mid-on. Good over, only three runs off it
clips a good length ball to deep midwicket
but with long-off back, Amla can take the least risk, presenting the full face, and keep taking singles
tosses it up, slows it down, but it drifts down leg. De Kock goes for a sweep and misses
blocks a good length ball on middle
a little too close to leg stump and de Kock turns it to the right of short fine leg
point was brought up off the boundary, and Amla makes them pay with a cut shot so perfectly placed. Plays it late enough to get it past the left of the man up inside the circle
whips the flatter delivery on middle to deep midwicket
back of a length on off stump, pushes it to cover
good length, on off stump, but Amla, with that shuffle back and across, is able to work it away to deep square leg.
too short, and it sits up on this slow pitch. De Kock pulls it fiercely to the midwicket boundary. Beautiful, brutal hitting
full on middle and leg, de Kock defends
full on off stump, de Kock drops and runs to the left of cover. This time Amla responds immediately and they make it easily with Taskin not even picking up the ball
back of a length and outside off, Amla tries to smear it through extra cover but gets an inside edge. Signs of the pitch being slow again
cuts a shortish delivery, that has very little room on it, straight to point
moves around the wicket for a back of a length ball on off stump. De Kock chops it down to deep third man
swivels on the back foot as he pulls down to long leg
full on leg stump, heaves it away to deep square
sets up for the pull, but Taskin, from around the wicket, cuts into the freedom he has to play that shot. Misses it, although the bowler thinks there's an inside edge
carves a shortish delivery to backward point
stands up tall and crunches a back of a length delivery outside off to the sweeper cover
not enough room to cut, which is why when he goes for the shot, he inside edges to point
launches the leg-stump half-volley over mid-on with such power! Brings up the 150 for South Africa, and the partnership.
full and outside off, slices it to deep point
outside edge wanders away to the third man boundary. Amla doesn't quite moves his feet as he throws his hands outside off and enjoys watching the ball fly past the wicketkeeper
nudges a good length ball on off stump to square leg
beats Amla with a back of a length delivery that straightens off the pitch. Bangladesh not giving up, as is clear from Taskin running in hard and hitting the deck to make it work for him
flicks a short delivery on the pads to deep square leg
defends a good length, slower ball, on off stump. And as it takes its time to reach midwicket, which is a Mashrafe held up by knee-braces, de Kock takes the single
short and wide, Amla smacks it to the sweeper cover
clips a shortish delivery on leg stump to deep midwicket
short-arm pulls a shortish delivery to deep square leg
pitches it up and gets the ball to straighten on middle. Amla, for that reason, makes sure to block it close to the body with soft hands
works it through midwicket
full on off stump, drives to long-on
loops it up on off stump, Amla drives to the sweeper cover
taps a full delivery down to long-on and an annoyed Shakib concedes yet another single
pushes it through on middle, Amla gets across on off stump and whips it to deep square leg
back of a length, slower ball, dabs it to deep third man
blocks a fullish delivery on off stump, from around the wicket
back of a length on middle and leg, clips it to square leg
picks up a length ball and smokes it down the ground. De Kock is sailing through to a hundred. Phew, that looked so easy for him
misfield at square leg, and de Kock moves on to 97 with a pull
short and outside off, punches it to point
good length ball on middle, de Kock works it away to deep midwicket
full and outside off, drives to the sweeper cover
gets to his 13th century with a sweet little cut shot behind point. Just a shade short, and off he goes, backs away to the leg side and carves it like Thanksgiving turkey
good length ball on middle, defends
works a shortish delivery on middle to long-on
shifts back to turn a good length ball to backward square leg
drives a back of a length delivery down to long-off
slower, back of a length delivery on off stump. Amla gently tips behind square leg
full and outside off, de Kock drills it to mid-off and yelps 'oh no' because he couldn't quite place it wide of the fielder
hammers it through the covers. Just enough width for de Kock to free his arms and nail it to the right of the fielder saving one
slower ball on leg stump, heaves it away to deep square leg
back of a length on off stump, Amla just shuffles across and nudges it to long leg
clips a shortish delivery on off stump to backward square leg
full on middle, de Kock turns it to deep midwicket
backs away and punches a flatter delivery on middle to cover
clips a good length ball on middle to square leg
defends a full delivery on middle
goes back and clips a shortish delivery on leg stump to midwicket
backs away and drills a shortish delivery to extra cover
defends a full delivery on middle
spears a full delivery outside off through the covers to bring up the 200 partnership. Fierce hitting.
gets down for the sweep and a good length ball on off stump also yields a single
full on off stump, drives to long-on
blocks a flatter delivery on leg stump to long-on.
flat and quick on leg stump, and he gets down low to use the pace and lap it over the keeper's right shoulder. Makes it look so easy, but it's everything but easy
tossed up on middle and leg, swept to deep square leg
full on off stump, driven to sweeper cover
back of a length close to off stump, pushed gently down the ground to long-off
full on leg stump, driven firmly back to the bowler
floaty yorker close to leg stump. Gets his feet out of the way to jab to extra-cover
yorker outside off, jabbed into the covers
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, punched to long-on
back of a length close to off stump, punched to the left of extra-cover
full outside off, punched hard to extra-cover
slower ball on the pads, clipped to deep square leg
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away to deep square leg
flat on the pads, clipped to backward square leg
flat, down the leg side. Amla misses the flick
tossed up on off stump, leans forward and eases a drive to sweeper cover
back of a length on off stump, makes a bit of room to punch to extra-cover
back of a length on the pads, tucked away to deep square leg
floated up slow on middle stump, driven to long-off
flighted outside leg, clipped through square leg
shortish, angling into the body, only gets up to hip height. Fine leg is inside the circle and he just helps it to the right of the desperately diving fielder
full-toss on off stump, mid-off is inside the circle and fairly wide, and de Kock just punches it with a straight bat into the big gap to his left
full on off stump, and de Kock drives into the same boundary as the previous ball, a step forward and a high-elbow finish
shortish, a bit of width, stabbed away to the right of deep point
overpitched close to off stump, and Amla drills a drive into the gap between extra-cover and mid-off. This is getting too easy for South Africa now
slower short ball outside off, lets it come on and dabs to third man

oh my, a chance! And Taskin puts it down. Full on off stump and Amla is a little early into his drive. Pops up a reflex caught-and-bowled at knee height, to Taskin's right, and he gets both hands to it but the ball pops out
slower short ball, de Kock plays a controlled pull off his hip to long leg
back of a length outside off, looks to guide it to third man but plays it squarer than he'd like, and backward point moves left to deny him a single
short, wide, and Amla uppercuts to the left of deep point to move to 99
back of a length outside off, and Amla brings up his 26th ODI hundred with a neat little dab to third man. What a player
short outside leg, swivels to pull to long leg
full on off stump, clipped to long-on
back of a length outside off, Amla picks up another steered single to third man
slower ball on off stump, defended back to the bowler
bang. Fullish on off stump, and de Kock shuffles across and gets down on one knee to sweep it high over square leg. Lands right on top of the boundary cushions, and gets stuck between two of them
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
back of a length on off stump, clipped to long-on and that brings up his second 150 in ODIs
slower bouncer, pulled away to deep square leg
back of a length outside off, dabbed to third man
fullish outside off, driven to sweeper cover
slower ball, back of a length, outside off. It's almost like they're gifting him these singles to third man
short, angling into the front hip, pulled to long leg
back of a length outside off, steered down to third man. Rinse, repeat
slower ball on the pads, clipped into the gap between deep square leg and long leg
slower ball outside off, dabbed to backward point
full slower ball on off stump, Amla eases a checked drive to sweeper cover
length ball close to off stump, punched down to long-on
short outside off, pulled to deep square leg
back of a length close to off stump, punched to mid-off

back of a length angling down leg. Appeal for a catch down the leg side, not given. Are they reviewing? Nope. Looked for the leg glance, Amla - not sure if it touched anything. Was pretty far from his thigh pad, and it hasn't hit his bat or glove either, Snicko confirms
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
bam. Slower ball outside off, back of a length, and de Kock opens up at the hips and flat-bats it over mid-on
back of a length, down leg, can't connect with the flick
full, on the pads, clipped through square leg. Taskin appeals for lbw despite the fact that he middled it, the ball didn't hit his pad at all, and the impact of bat on pad happened outside leg stump
yorker close to off stump, jabbed to backward point
another yorker, dug out towards extra-cover

short outside off, and Nasir has dropped a catch at long-on. De Kock smashes it down the ground, a tennis-style forehand drive, and Nasir, jumping at long-on, gets both hands to it over his head, but can't hold on
slower bouncer, swivels to help it down to long leg
length ball close to off stump, driven to mid-off

full on off stump, and de Kock finishes with a six, or has he? Opens up at the hips and just hoicks it away over midwicket. This match is over if it's landed on the rope, but replays suggest it may have bounced just inside. It looks like it's yorked the rope
length ball on off stump, and he clears his front leg and swipes it away to the left of midwicket. Four more, and South Africa have truly crushed Bangladesh here
